function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Introduction of CoV-19 and social lockdowns leading to changes in environmental indices","Impact":"Potential bounce-back of nature under COVID-19 induced lockdown, but risk of disease transmission remains","Mitigation":"Implementation of voluntary lockdowns to allow nature to self-regenerate while minimizing the risk of disease transmission","Technologies":"Public health measures, remote work arrangements, digital communication tools","People":"General public, policy makers, environmental experts","Owner":"Policy makers, government authorities"},{"Description":"Reduction of Nitrogen dioxide (NO2) emissions due to industrial and vehicular operations coming to a halt during the pandemic","Impact":"Improved air quality due to diminished NO2 emissions, but potential risk of resuming emissions after lockdown","Mitigation":"Investment in clean energy, remote work arrangements, regulations on industrial emissions","Technologies":"Clean energy technologies, remote monitoring systems, emission control technologies","People":"Environmental experts, industrial stakeholders, government authorities","Owner":"Government authorities, environmental agencies"},{"Description":"Radical drop in NO2 emissions in Italy, China, and India","Impact":"Significant improvement in air quality, but potential impact on public health and disease transmission","Mitigation":"Continued monitoring of air quality, public health awareness campaigns, investment in clean energy","Technologies":"Air quality monitoring systems, public health information systems, clean energy technologies","People":"General public, environmental experts, public health authorities","Owner":"Government authorities, environmental agencies"}]}
